snippet: A study from Spain concludes that the blood-pressure-lowering effects of red wine come from the beneficial chemicals called polyphenols that it contains, though alcohol may limit their effects.
abstract: A study from Spain concludes that the blood-pressure-lowering effects of red wine come from the beneficial chemicals called polyphenols that it contains, though alcohol may limit their effects.

headline.main: Without Alcohol, Red Wine Is Still Beneficial
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs | Nutrition: Without Alcohol, Red Wine Is Still Beneficial
